instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SPI_MOSI: What is SPI_MOSI? SPI_MOSI is a signal between the CPU or PCH and the SPI ROM bios chip that is necessary for the machine to POST and boot. If this signal line is corroded or the BIOS chip has failed then you will not get PM_SLP_S4_L and the machine will not boot. Very often this line is corroded by liquid damage. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power cycling.
threads.message:
Hi All,
This is liquid damaged board. but not much. Upto <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> stable.Other than all power rails including Vcore is pulsing for a second.fan does not spin at all. 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> also pulsing come around 2.3v and 0v.

What can see TP[01] <SIGNAL>SPI_MOSI</SIGNAL> TEST POINT IS BURNT.
But the connectivity from <RESISTOR>R6112</RESISTOR> pin 2 to <RESISTOR>R6127</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R6122</RESISTOR> is there. voltages 3.3v

Checked the bios area all resistors acurate. Any idea ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power cycling.
threads.message: Sounds like one of the BIOS traces is corroded/broken. Sounds like you already found the one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power cycling.
threads.message:
Check cpntinuity to pin 5 (not only) of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
Pins 5/6 should drop to 0V when you get pulse on VCORE.

Remove J6100 if looks dirty; try to clean at least.
Also check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power cycling.
threads.message:
Hi Thank you for your reply.

continuity to Pin 5 from <RESISTOR>R6115</RESISTOR> anf <RESISTOR>R6122</RESISTOR> is there.pin 5/6 has puling 3.3v to 1.9v.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, and other rails pulsing to around 1.5v to 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power cycling.
threads.message: Also <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> area is clean and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> is pulsing too.
